channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-439] javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException: org.apache.activemq:BrokerName=root,Type=Broker
item.description:
I started the full esb 040 and created a fabric.

And got this exception in the console

FuseESB:karaf@root> fabric:create 
No user found in etc/users.properties or specified as an option. Please specify one ...
 
New user name: admin
 
Password for admin: 
Verify password for admin:
 
Passwords did not match. Please try again!
 
Password for admin: 
Verify password for admin:
 
javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException: org.apache.activemq:BrokerName=root,Type=Broker
 
	at com.sun.jmx.mbeanserver.Repository.addMBean(Repository.java:453)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.internal_addObject(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:1484)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerDynamicMBean(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:963)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerObject(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:917)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerMBean(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:312)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.mbeanserver.JmxMBeanServer.registerMBean(JmxMBeanServer.java:482)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.jmx.ManagementContext.registerMBean(ManagementContext.java:366)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.jmx.AnnotatedMBean.registerMBean(AnnotatedMBean.java:72)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.BrokerService.startManagementContext(BrokerService.java:2370)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.BrokerService.start(BrokerService.java:567)
 
	at org.fusesource.mq.fabric.ActiveMQServiceFactory$ClusteredConfiguration$$anon$3.run(ActiveMQServiceFactory.scala:307)
 
Zookeeper password not specified or generated.
 
You can use the --zookeeper-password option to specify one.
 
Or you can use the --generate-zookeeper-password to have fabric generate one for you.
 
Reusing users admin password:admin
 
You can retrieve the zookeeper password at any time using the fabric:ensemble-password command.
 
FuseESB:karaf@root> javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException: org.apache.activemq:BrokerName=root,Type=Broker
 
	at com.sun.jmx.mbeanserver.Repository.addMBean(Repository.java:453)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.internal_addObject(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:1484)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerDynamicMBean(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:963)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerObject(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:917)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerMBean(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:312)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.mbeanserver.JmxMBeanServer.registerMBean(JmxMBeanServer.java:482)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.jmx.ManagementContext.registerMBean(ManagementContext.java:366)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.jmx.AnnotatedMBean.registerMBean(AnnotatedMBean.java:72)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.BrokerService.startManagementContext(BrokerService.java:2370)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.BrokerService.start(BrokerService.java:567)
 
	at org.fusesource.mq.fabric.ActiveMQServiceFactory$ClusteredConfiguration$$anon$3.run(ActiveMQServiceFactory.scala:307)
 
javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException: org.apache.activemq:BrokerName=root,Type=Broker
 
	at com.sun.jmx.mbeanserver.Repository.addMBean(Repository.java:453)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.internal_addObject(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:1484)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerDynamicMBean(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:963)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerObject(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:917)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerMBean(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:312)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.mbeanserver.JmxMBeanServer.registerMBean(JmxMBeanServer.java:482)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.jmx.ManagementContext.registerMBean(ManagementContext.java:366)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.jmx.AnnotatedMBean.registerMBean(AnnotatedMBean.java:72)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.BrokerService.startManagementContext(BrokerService.java:2370)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.BrokerService.start(BrokerService.java:567)
 
	at org.fusesource.mq.fabric.ActiveMQServiceFactory$ClusteredConfiguration$$anon$3.run(ActiveMQServiceFactory.scala:307)
 
...

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Dejan, would you know what the problem is?

I get this again, even if I have configured the users.properties as told.

@Claus, can you attach the log file?

The default broker is still enabled via etc/org.fusesource.mq.fabric.server-default.cfg bit it may be some race condition that is causing it to be started twice.

@Dejan - that looks a little like the symptom I got when the xml config watcher thread was over eager, but the -1 check should have sorted that. this may be another angle on that.

Just tried again with a fresh 040 full esb. I added the smx=smx,admin user.

davsclaus:/opt/fuse-esb-7.1.0.fuse-040$ bin/fuseesb 
Please wait while Fuse Fabric is loading...
 
100% [====================================================================================================]
 
 
 
______                   _____  _____ ______ 
|  ___|                 |  ___|/  ___|| ___ \
 
| |_  _   _  ___   ___  | |__  \ `--. | |_/ /
 
|  _|| | | |/ __| / _ \ |  __|  `--. \| ___ \
 
| |  | |_| |\__ \|  __/ | |___ /\__/ /| |_/ /
 
\_|   \__,_||___/ \___| \____/ \____/ \____/
 
 
 
  Fuse ESB (7.1.0.fuse-040)
 
  http://fusesource.com/products/fuse-esb-enterprise/
 
 
 
Hit '<tab>' for a list of available commands
 
and '[cmd] --help' for help on a specific command.
 
Hit '<ctrl-d>' or 'osgi:shutdown' to shutdown Fuse ESB.
 
 
 
FuseESB:karaf@root> fabric:create --clean
 
javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException: org.apache.activemq:BrokerName=root,Type=Broker
 
	at com.sun.jmx.mbeanserver.Repository.addMBean(Repository.java:453)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.internal_addObject(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:1484)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerDynamicMBean(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:963)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerObject(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:917)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.interceptor.DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.registerMBean(DefaultMBeanServerInterceptor.java:312)
 
	at com.sun.jmx.mbeanserver.JmxMBeanServer.registerMBean(JmxMBeanServer.java:482)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.jmx.ManagementContext.registerMBean(ManagementContext.java:366)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.jmx.AnnotatedMBean.registerMBean(AnnotatedMBean.java:72)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.BrokerService.startManagementContext(BrokerService.java:2370)
 
	at org.apache.activemq.broker.BrokerService.start(BrokerService.java:567)
 
	at org.fusesource.mq.fabric.ActiveMQServiceFactory$ClusteredConfiguration$$anon$3.run(ActiveMQServiceFactory.scala:307)
 
Zookeeper password not specified or generated.
 
You can use the --zookeeper-password option to specify one.
 
Or you can use the --generate-zookeeper-password to have fabric generate one for you.
 
Reusing users smx password:smx
 
You can retrieve the zookeeper password at any time using the fabric:ensemble-password command.

Attaching log file now...

In fact I have these 2 users now

smx=smx,admin
 
admin=admin,admin

This is now fixed. The problem was in that one broker is started when esb starts. Then fabric:create starts another instance (this time zk provisioned) broker. These two brokers had the same name (root), so they clashed over JMX.

The solution was to rename standalone broker and give it more distinguished fusemq name.
